nodes.bodyText: javadoc : Get a list of read-only credentials sequentially   ? Since it is unmodifiableList
Should we move this up to ChainedTokenCredential? That way users who created a CTC can continue to extract the list for further modification.

I think not,
as that will allow users to alter the behavior of an already instantiated credential.
It might be fine, if we return back a copy.
But, this is not applied towards all languages as per the proposal.
Why returning an unmodifiable list here? I thought the intention of this API is return a copy of the current list for the user to modify before creating a CTC out of it.

I think @schaabs said, we either return immutable list or a copy of it.
I think having it immutable prevents the use of indexes to replace/re-order items in place. and will require users to create their custom list whenever they want to modify it.
We can return a copy too.

Can this be a List instead?
#12203 (comment)
as, discussed, keeping it to Colleciton.
This should return an unmodifiable list. Create the unmodifiable list in the ctor itself.

The description here says that the list is read-only is this the case? It's returning the underlying instance of credentials as a List<TokenCredential>? We want to make sure we don't allow people to mutate the state of the already created credential.
Discussed this offline, and since we're using Colletions.unmodifiableList to create this instance we can return it without worrying about users modifying it.
